conclusion: Objects above slabs are illuminated by a light source, casting shadows A, B, and C on the ground.
Shadow A is cast by a birdcage, shadow B is cast by a cup, and shadow C is cast by a chicken drumstick.
When the light source moves to the right, shadows will move to the left.
As the light source moves to the right, the distance between the light source and the objects increases, causing the shadows to become smaller.
A will move to the left and become smaller.
B will move to the left and become smaller.
C will move to the left and become smaller.
